review_title: Overall a good place to work
job_title: Medical Assistant in Pomona, CA
pros: Good insurance and work life balance, management is also fair
cons: We go through periods under staffed

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Pomona, CA
pros: Weekend and night differential, ok pay
cons: Toxic work environment, poor management

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) in Pomona, CA
pros: Good experience, Helpful employees, Self scheduling

review_title: Great benefits, but too much expected from company.
job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Pomona, CA
pros: -great benefits and retirement savings plan -friendly environment -helpful interdisciplinary team that works together for rehab services -transparent with communication ( a little too much, though) -many resources available for staff -great clinical training from experienced staff members
cons: -They expect A LOT from their employees. The trainers (who have mostly been there 10+ years) are VERY critical and nitpick at small details or concerns. -Micromanagement of employees in training (ex- cannot look at phone while in public areas, cannot make casual conversation with other nursing or medical staff, will write you up for clocking in 2-3 minutes late, no yawning on job, needs to know where you are located or what you are doing at all times during training) -Feels like trainers are watching your every move and will accuse you of being "defensive" if you try and explain why you chose a certain treatment strategy that they did not agree with. -Your training experience, such as daily schedule and patient load, will be highly managed and structured for you without your input or suggestion. -Management will talk about your "performance" amongst themselves on a regular basis (without your input) and it feels as though they will all agree with each other. - Probationary period (which is 3 months) you are expected to have PERFECT attendance. This means you cannot clock in even 1 minute late, or take a day off even if you are sick. They will write you up for this. They will also tell you that you are making "excuses" when you try and explain why you were late.

job_title: Diet Tech in Pomona, CA
pros: fast-paced environment. team work. growth opportunity.
cons: weak management at the time. limited training

job_title: Physical Therapy Aide in Pomona, CA
pros: Most people that work here are good caring people.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Pomona, CA
pros: Good pay, room to move within the organization and find where you fit in.
cons: Scheduling is a little rigid.

job_title: New Grad RN in Pomona, CA
pros: Average pay for new grads in the area from what I’ve heard / researched
cons: Must work 2 weekends/month. No extra pay for having a bachelors or masters, or for having extra credentials

job_title: Service Desk Technician in Pomona, CA

job_title: Registered Nurse in Pomona, CA

review_title: Great Place to Work For To Learn and Make Friends
job_title: Emergency Department Technician in Pomona, CA
pros: Staff is amazing and hard working no matter how crazy it gets everyone pitches in sees what needs to be done and does it. The physicians, physician assistants and nurses are a wealth of knowledge and have a lot to teach. This is a great place to learn and sharpen your skills.
cons:
Pay is not the best.
Administration does not seem to care about the safety of it employees when it comes to staffing adequately keeping ratios within a safe range and has actively worked against patient care employees getting salary raises and being able to unionize .

review_title: Good place to get experience, network

Got the feeling of working full-time 
Many nurses are willing to teach, large hospital and trauma center 
Good pay considering this is pre-licensure, especially night+weekend+overtime+holiday differential 
Good opportunity, many of us were offered a new graduate job afterwards
cons: Scheduling seemed lopsided for nurse externs. Sometimes scheduled with little time off between 3 shifts on.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Pomona, CA
pros: There’s a reason why people end up staying here for years. For the most part, they treat their staff well and will try to accommodate your needs. You actually have CNAs that will help you with vitals, cleaning patients, etc whereas other hospitals there are barely any CNAs on the floor so you would have to do everything. They pay pretty well since they are a LA county hospital.
cons: Micromanagement from managers, the usual gossipers but they’re literally at every hospital

job_title: Clinical Analyst in Pomona, CA

job_title: Clerical Associate in Alturas, CA
pros: Nice people to work with. Loved the patient and family demographics we dealt with.  Pediatric hospitalists were very good and dedicated.
cons: This was a physically labor heavy position for a clerical associate. Clerical associates should not be doing patient transport and patient bed/room modifications, i.e., moving cribs, junior beds, and adult beds for room set ups throughout a ward.  The need to move equipment exists but a clerical position should not be doing it.  Clerical associates should be doing all clerical aspects and providing clerical support not physical labor.  .

review_title: A good employer, but only if one is an ongoing employee.
job_title: LVN in Pomona, CA
pros: Competitive pay scale and some good nurses.
cons: Phasing out of LVNs, which is unfortunate because it is usually the employees who are not RNs that are appreciative and love their jobs, which in turn results in better patient care or overall satisfaction. I guess such things as loyalty, hard work, and consideration of analytical and practical skills in not as important as a piece of paper.

job_title: ER Admitting Representative in Pomona, CA
pros: Supportive of continuing education, innovative technology, competent/educated coworkers, family friendly workplace, easy freeway access for those who commute, great cafeteria, nurses and physicians all pull their own weight, ongoing training, clean working conditions, friendly people, great volunteers and just an all around great place to work.
cons: Surrounding area isn't the greatest, parking is not very convenient, understaffing can be an issue at times, employees often speak amongst each other in their native languages which is often frowned upon by patients.

review_title: A perfect place to work as part of a team serving patients of all ages and acuity.
job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Pomona, CA
pros: Co-workers are like family, there is always good teamwork.  There are great learning experiences available in all the departments.  I love our Respiratory Therapy department!
cons: I travel 40 miles one way but my shift starts early enough that I miss most of the westbound traffic.

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Riverside, CA
pros: I have been working with this hospital for 30 years. The benefits and salary is competitive, good working condition , their very innovative in terms of laboratory equipment and managers are  approachable  if ever you have some problems with you work.
cons: For the last 30 years i"d been with this company , i have never experience major problem that i should worry about my job. As long as you perform as expected , and in my situation i exceeded that, you will be alright.

review_title: A great company to work for
job_title: DataBase, Monitor Technician in Pomona, CA
pros: Some of the smartest doctors and amazing nurses i'v ever worked with. Good benefits, fair pay. They have a lot of other benefits for associates. The hospital keeps improving to meet the needs of the population in the area and surrounding areas. They always give out awards for a job well done and do events not just for the staff but also creates events for the public  to enjoy such as: A visit from Santa with pictures taken, etc...
cons: some units are more organized then others.

cons: They work you kind of hard they use to give the CNA's like 10 patients, and want u to take care of every need basically with out RN's help.
